summary: The "Don't Miss Your Flight Act" proposes a grant program for surface transportation infrastructure projects connecting to airports. It defines eligible entities (States, Indian Tribes, and local governments) and projects (highway, public transportation, or passenger rail projects) that connect to public airports and improve infrastructure within a 5-mile radius. The bill mandates funding allocation, with a minimum percentage for projects connecting to large and medium hub airports. It also details cost-sharing provisions and authorizes the appropriation of $1,000,000,000 annually from the Highway Trust Fund for fiscal years 2027-2031.
